getOnClickListener().Description: Use @B_android#view#textclassifier#TextClassification#getActions_E@ instead. Returns the OnClickListener that may be triggered to act on the classified text. @B_android#app#RemoteAction_E@ (if one exists) when this object is read from a parcel.
getOnClickListener().history: Added in API level 26 Deprecated in API level 28

getEntityCount().Description: Returns the number of entities found in the classified text.

getIcon().Description: Use @B_android#view#textclassifier#TextClassification#getActions_E@ instead. Returns an icon that may be rendered on a widget used to act on the classified text. @B_android#app#RemoteAction_E@ (if one exists) when this object is read from a parcel.
getIcon().history: Added in API level 26 Deprecated in API level 28

Parameters: Parcel: The Parcel in which the object should be written.
int: Additional flags about how the object should be written. May be 0 or @B_android#os#Parcelable#PARCELABLE_WRITE_RETURN_VALUE_E@.

writeToParcel(android.os.Parcel, int).FullName: public void writeToParcel (Parcel dest, int flags)

getConfidenceScore(java.lang.String).Description: Returns the confidence score for the specified entity. The value ranges from 0 (low confidence) to 1 (high confidence). 0 indicates that the entity was not found for the classified text.

getActions().Description: Returns a list of actions that may be performed on the text. The list is ordered based on the likelihood that a user will use the action, with the most likely action appearing first.

Returns: a bitmask indicating the set of special object types marshaled by this Parcelable object instance. Value is either 0 or @B_android#os#Parcelable#CONTENTS_FILE_DESCRIPTOR_E@
describeContents().Description: Describe the kinds of special objects contained in this Parcelable instance's marshaled representation. For example, if the object will include a file descriptor in the output of @B_android#os#Parcelable#writeToParcel_E@, the return value of this method must include the @B_android#os#Parcelable#CONTENTS_FILE_DESCRIPTOR_E@ bit.

getLabel().Description: Use @B_android#view#textclassifier#TextClassification#getActions_E@ instead. Returns a label that may be rendered on a widget used to act on the classified text. @B_android#app#RemoteAction_E@ (if one exists) when this object is read from a parcel.
getLabel().history: Added in API level 26 Deprecated in API level 28

Returns: a string representation of the object.
toString().Description: Returns a string representation of the object. In general, the toString method returns a string that "textually represents" this object. The result should be a concise but informative representation that is easy for a person to read. It is recommended that all subclasses override this method. The toString method for class Object returns a string consisting of the name of the class of which the object is an instance, the at-sign character `@', and the unsigned hexadecimal representation of the hash code of the object. In other words, this method returns a string equal to the value of:

Returns: This value will never be null.

getId().Description: Returns the id, if one exists, for this object.

Returns: This value will never be null. Value is @B_android#view#textclassifier#TextClassifier#TYPE_UNKNOWN_E@, @B_android#view#textclassifier#TextClassifier#TYPE_OTHER_E@, @B_android#view#textclassifier#TextClassifier#TYPE_EMAIL_E@, @B_android#view#textclassifier#TextClassifier#TYPE_PHONE_E@, @B_android#view#textclassifier#TextClassifier#TYPE_ADDRESS_E@, @B_android#view#textclassifier#TextClassifier#TYPE_URL_E@, @B_android#view#textclassifier#TextClassifier#TYPE_DATE_E@, @B_android#view#textclassifier#TextClassifier#TYPE_DATE_TIME_E@, @B_android#view#textclassifier#TextClassifier#TYPE_FLIGHT_NUMBER_E@, or android.view.textclassifier.TextClassifier.TYPE_DICTIONARY
Throws: if the specified index is out of range.
getEntity(int).Description: Returns the entity at the specified index. Entities are ordered from high confidence to low confidence.

getIntent().Description: Use @B_android#view#textclassifier#TextClassification#getActions_E@ instead. Returns an intent that may be fired to act on the classified text.
getIntent().history: Added in API level 26 Deprecated in API level 28

ClassDesc: Information for generating a widget to handle classified text. A TextClassification object contains icons, labels, onClickListeners and intents that may be used to build a widget that can be used to act on classified text. There is the concept of a e.g. building a view that, when clicked, shares the classified text with the preferred app: e.g. starting an action mode with menu items that can handle the classified text:
